Replace.Text: We are aligned.
The stars are not right.
The War Serpent wanes in the sky, and good feelings rise. Shall we be friends?
We shine together in the sky, you and I.
I must have misjudged you.
I will not allow you to remain in power any longer. You have offended me for too long!
You are unworthy of rulership. I will take your cities and your people, and rule them for you.
Your delegation has been allowed to visit our capital. I promise none will be forced to the great altar of the War Serpent.
Your delegation is unwelcome. Except, maybe, as a sacrifice?
My envoys bring to you drinking chocolate, ground with chili peppers and honey. Will you let them in?
Jaguars will come for you in the night, and no one will mourn your passing!
I spoke my counsel with patience, and you did not heed it. I speak it now in anger and frustration. (Denounces You).
You are in the presence of Lady Six Sky, priestess and warrior, queen of the Maya. Greetings.

We have a match between our two best teams in the ball court. For the winners, we have a festival arranged at the temple square. We have made arrangements for the losers atop the altar. Will you come and celebrate with us?
Yes.
Let us exchange information about our homes.
What brings you to me?
See that you continue to stay away from the Mayan homeland. For now the stars shine in your favor.
The stars themselves look away from your deeds. Do not approach my lands.
Venus sets at the appointed mark, and the moon rises over the pyramid. The signs are right for an alliance.
The stars turn again towards peace. I will also put down my arms.
No. Cizin, the lord of the underworld, still thirsts for blood.
Blood, blood. So much blood. Let it end.
Your people are welcome to walk our paths
Maya roads will not bear your people's feet.
May Maya feet walk your roads?
Your warriors mass near Mayan lands. Remove them at once!
The War Serpent has guided us here. Who are you to deny us?
The War Serpent does not come for you. We will withdraw.
The cycle of the Maya ends. But the end of your time will come, too. I pray it will be soon.
This is not the time.
The stars are right.
Lady Six Sky is disturbed by you settling near one of her cities.
Lady Six Sky is pleased that you settled far away from her empire.
Yes! Let us break the chains of servitude together!
I am not yet convinced that you fight for liberty.
We both serve the Revolution. Shall we plow the sea together?
Excellent!
I extend my hand to you, and you slap it away. Sad.
Recourse to war is regrettable, but necessary, when dealing with vipers like you.
Your tyranny, if unchecked, dooms the world to darkness, and for this reason I must declare war on you.
We held a parade and a festival in the town square in your delegation's honor. They had a long night. Let them sleep in.
Gran Colombia walks its own path today.
I send to you a delegation of my finest horsemen carrying coffee and sugar. Will you let them in?
Tyrant! Oppressor of the people! Foe of liberty! Your day of reckoning approaches!
Perhaps you can deceive others, but I have no illusions about your wicked designs. (Denounces You).
I, President Simon Bolivar, welcome you to Gran Colombia.
We are holding an open debate in my city about the nature of freedom. Would you like to come and listen to me talk?
Yes.
In the spirit of friendship, let us visit each other's capital.
Welcome back.
It seems that you understand both history and statecraft with a well promoted army. Your people benefit from your leadership.
May I offer a friendly word of warning? Change your ways, friend, or those who lead promoted armies will change them for you.
Will you join me in my struggle for liberty?
Yes, the time for peace has come. Let us lay down our arms.
We will not turn back! We ride forward, to our liberation and to your ruin!
Here. I offer my saber in the interests of peace. Let us talk terms.
Yes, let us march together!
Leave the roads of Colombia to the free.
May the armies of liberation march through your lands?
Your forces threaten our lands. Remove them at once!
The glorious armies of liberty cannot be moved.
The glorious armies of liberty will take themselves elsewhere.
Everything I have done, I did for the nation of Gran Colombia. I remain a patriot to the very end.
I know a rotten deal when I see one.
Yes! Let us both profit from this!
Simón Bolívar is happy with the advancement of your troops.
